thread.title: Police: Man Impersonating Uber Driver Sexually Assaults 2 Women
thread.title_full: Police: Man Impersonating Uber Driver Sexually Assaults 2 Women

title: Police: Man Impersonating Uber Driver Sexually Assaults 2 Women

persons.name: charlie de mar charlie de mar

text:
Police: Man Impersonating Uber Driver Sexually Assaults 2 Women March 21, 2017 5:18 PM By Charlie De Mar 
CHICAGO (CBS) — A 33-year-old Glenview man is accused of posing as an Uber driver, picking up women in Chicago, and sexually assaulting them in a suburb. 
Musaab S. Afandi was being held without bond on aggravated kidnapping and aggravated sexual assault charges. 
Skokie police say Afandi impersonated an Uber driver when he picked up a woman in the 2500 block of North Halsted in Chicago on Feb. 12. 
He allegedly drove her to a neighborhood in Skokie and sexually assaulted her in the car. 
Afandi committed a similar crime early Sunday. A woman tells police she got into his car after leaving a Wrigleyville bar and was assaulted in a quiet neighborhood. 
Afandi was arrested Monday. Charlie De Mar Charlie De Mar is a general assignment reporter for CBS 2. De Mar came to CBS 2 from WTTV and WXIN, the CBS and Fox stations in Indianapolis, IN, where he has reported lead stories for the stations’ evening newscasts. De Mar is credited with...
